body:
Two questions:

- Should the device_index be int64_t instead of int32_t? I think @ezyang suggested the former was appropriate for cases like this.
- Instead of creating separate CUDAStreamGuard and CUDADeviceGuard and probably CUDADeviceAndStreamGuard classes, does it make sense to create a single CUDAGuard class that can accept setting the device or stream or both? I actually need to set both in #8354, and at the time created an AutoGPUStream (based on the existing AutoGPU and AutoStream). I'd like to get rid of that (obviously) and use a class like this, and I think the logic is so similar between these three use cases that they are likely best combined into one class.
